procedures.name: Straight Catheterization
steps: Gather necessary supplies.
Explain the procedure to the patient.
Ensure privacy and proper positioning.
Use aseptic technique to insert the catheter into the bladder.
Secure the catheter in place and ensure proper drainage.

procedures.name: Foley Catheter Insertion
steps: Gather necessary supplies.
Explain the procedure to the patient.
Ensure privacy and proper positioning.
Use aseptic technique to insert the Foley catheter into the bladder.
Secure the catheter in place and ensure proper drainage.
indications: Monitoring urine output in critically ill patients.

procedures.name: Fecal Management System Insertion
steps: Explain the procedure to the patient.
Ensure privacy and proper positioning.
Use aseptic technique to insert the fecal management system.
Secure the system in place and provide proper care.
indications: Prevention of skin breakdown in bedridden patients.

procedures.name: Central Line Dressing Replacement
steps: Gather necessary supplies.
Explain the procedure to the patient.
Ensure privacy and proper positioning.
Remove the old dressing using aseptic technique.
Apply a new sterile dressing and secure in place.
indications: Prevention of infection at the central line site.
Maintenance of a sterile field for central line access.

procedures.name: Removal of Arterial Line
steps: Verify patient information.
Explain the procedure to the patient.
Gather necessary supplies.
Apply sterile technique to remove the arterial line.
Monitor the patient for any adverse reactions.
indications: Resolution of the condition requiring arterial monitoring.
contraindications: Active infection at the removal site.

procedures.name: Venipuncture for Blood Cultures
steps: Gather necessary supplies.
Explain the procedure to the patient.
Identify the appropriate venipuncture site.
Collect blood samples for cultures.
Label and send the samples to the laboratory.
indications: Monitoring for sepsis in critically ill patients.
contraindications: Known allergies to blood collection materials.

procedures.name: Arterial Line Blood Sample
steps: Gather necessary supplies.
Explain the procedure to the patient.
Identify the arterial line for sampling.
Collect arterial blood samples for ABG analysis.
Label and send the samples to the laboratory.
indications: Assessment of respiratory and metabolic status.
Monitoring oxygenation in critically ill patients.
contraindications: Known allergies to blood collection materials.
